summary: Gaeton J. Fonzi was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list Fonzi's name, along with other committee employees, their positions, salaries, and employment dates. He appears in payroll certifications for April 1978 and certification reports for August and December 1978. The documents do not specify Fonzi's exact role within the committee, but they confirm his employment during the SCAS investigation.
significance: The documents indicate that Gaeton J. Fonzi was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations, which investigated the JFK assassination. While the specific role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll suggests his involvement in the committee's work.
